data.author: Karl Schulz
data.message:
Using "sensor data" QoS profile with BEST_EFFORT (#67)

* Fixing #41 - using sensor data QoS profile with BEST_EFFORT

* Using SubscriptionOptions for QoS overrides

Co-authored-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

* Disable QoS overrides until they will actually work

We need to wait until ROS command-line arguments are properly parsed upstream.

Signed-off-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

Co-authored-by: Jacob Perron <jacob@openrobotics.org>

data.author: Dirk Thomas
data.message: update changelog

data.author: Dirk Thomas
data.message:
add option to render grid (#7)

* Adding an optional crosshair.

* Getting rid of one unnecessary, commented line & adding a nice icon.

* Allowing multiple rows/cols in overlayed grid & changing the gridlines to ivnerted pixels.

* Set # of strips via ROS param. New icon for saving the image.

* Dynamically adjust # gridlines.

* Setting num_gridlines as a plugin parameter. Using a 'stock image' for saving. Making num_gridlines_ more intuitive.

* Getting rid of the grid button. Minor formatting changes. Avoiding "partial cells" after int division.

* style only

* 2-px-wide center gridlines under the right conditions.

* Only black or white gridlines.

* Some convoluted logic to get a consistent centerline.

* modify algo to calculate grid

* optimize invertPixel function

data.author: Dirk Thomas
data.message: update changelog

data.author: Lucas Walter
data.message:
Get rid of the image border on the left and right side (#5)

* The default margin was 9 in all of these places where the margin property has been added, now the image is up to the left and right edges (is the bottom used for something?  Could eliminated that too), which maybe deserves a few pixels.

* fix indentation

* change margin to 1

data.author: Lucas Walter
data.message:
Don't shrink the image when the aspect ratio changes (#4)

* #3 Applying changes from https://github.com/ros-visualization/rqt_common_plugins/pull/441 to this new repo

* Getting rid of these magic numbers - the purpose was likely to better center the image within the previous containter (what came before the scroll area), and should have been query some margin instead of hardcoding.  The image is not currently centered within the scroll area, whichever edge is the constraining one is abutting the scrollarea border, while the other edges are many pixels separated.

* fix spelling

* Only update aspect ratio when a new image is received.

data.author: contradict
data.message:
[rqt_image_view] Add a scroll area

When selecting a 1-to-1 pixel view, the previous implementation resized the
window to the full image size. This is inconvenient for images much larger than
the screen resolution. This patch places the RatioLayoutedFrame in a ScrollArea
so the window still fits on the screen and the user can pan on the full image.
